title: How to Master Doom

steps.headline: Collect power ups.
steps.description: At the beginning of every level collect as many power ups as you can. Also do this as you play. You can do this by simply walking over them. Doing this will increase your chance of survival greatly.

steps.headline: Take cover.
steps.description: Don't just run into a room full of zombies without thinking. Try to find cover. Walls work especially good for this. You can also use other enemies as cover. Make sure you always have some cover to fall back to if your health starts to get low.

steps.headline: Have multiple weapons.
steps.description: You will start the first level with nothing but a pistol. Make sure you get more weapons! A pistol will not last you forever. When you play the more challenging levels of the game it's almost impossible to survive with only a pistol. Collect many different weapons as different weapons are more effective against different monsters. You can find weapons by killing certain enemies or through a secret.

steps.headline: Start playing on different difficulty levels.
steps.description: Eventually you will get too good for whatever difficulty you are on. When this happens, move up one and practice on that. This will improve your skills greatly.

steps.headline: Play often.
steps.description: Learn each level inside and out and memorize them. Know where the good weapons are, power ups are, good cover, and secret areas. A good way to this is to play with the infinite health cheat so you can explore without worrying about anything.

steps.headline: Look for secrets.
steps.description: Each level contains some secrets that contain goodies (weapons, powerups, health, etc.) that can help you. Secrets can often be found behind walls, from a switch, or some other trigger. If you’re having trouble finding secrets, you can look for a Computer Area Map in the Level, which shows every part of the level on the automap.

steps.headline: Strafe.
steps.description: Doom isn't a modern shooter, and unlike modern shooters, heavily rewards you for strafing. By strafing around enemies you make yourself harder to hit, as most of the projectiles aren't hitscan, but are instead physical projectiles.

steps.headline: Keep moving.
steps.description: If you have ever watched a doom speedrun, you will see that the faster you move the easier the level gets. Just look at the blue room with the pinkies from the chasam speedrun. Doom is structured so the faster you move, the harder it is for you to be hit and the more enemies you can take on.
